definitions.definition: not seeming to be based on a reason, system or plan and sometimes seeming unfair

examples.text: The choice of players for the team seemed completely arbitrary.

definitions.definition: using power without limits and without considering other people

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘dependent on one's will or pleasure, discretionary’): from Latin arbitrarius, from arbiter ‘judge, supreme ruler’, perhaps influenced by French arbitraire.
